page.title: 02CHURCH BUILDINGS
page.content: {St.Mary The Virgin,Rudford The building is of Norman design, dating from the 12th century.In 1848, the church was extensively restored by the rector,William Witton Mottlow. Behind the altar there is a stained glass window depicting biblical scenes. {St.Michael's church,Bulley This Norman and early English style church was built on Saxon foundations in the 12th century,but was left to ruin in Victorian times.However,at least one wedding took place in the ruins.The church,with a maximum seating capacity of 84,was restored in 1886 by S.Gambier-Parry.The baptism font is Norman and stands upon a restored base.
